privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: At Truk we take the protection of your data very seriously. This policy explains what information we collect, how we use it and what rights you have over it.

sections.title: 1. Information we collect
paragraphs: We collect strictly necessary information for the platform to function, to integrate with Web3 services and to improve the community experience.
bullets: Registration data: name, email, preferred language and community you belong to.
Usage information: activity within the platform, offers created, events you register for and credit transfers.
Content you share: text, images and opinions you voluntarily publish.
Identifiers linked to Web3 wallets and blockchain network addresses when you choose to connect MetaMask, Phantom or other compatible providers.

sections.title: 2. How we use your information
paragraphs: We use the data to facilitate exchange within the community, manage your Web3 identity and keep the platform secure.
We record in smart contracts or blockchain systems transactions that require traceability (for example, credit movements or gamified attendance confirmations).
We also analyse platform usage in aggregate to improve functionality, detect fraud and launch new community initiatives.

sections.title: 3. When we share information
paragraphs: We do not sell your personal data. We only share information with third parties when it is essential to provide the service or when required by regulations.
bullets: Technology providers who help us host, send emails or process payments.
When you give us explicit consent for a specific integration.
When a competent authority requests it legally.
Decentralised services necessary to publish transactions on blockchain (for example, nodes, explorers or storage networks) respecting minimisation principles.

sections.title: 4. Your rights
paragraphs: You can request access, rectification or deletion of your personal data at any time.
If you choose to unsubscribe, we will delete or anonymise your data except for those we must retain due to legal obligations.

sections.title: 5. Retention and security
paragraphs: We keep information for as long as necessary to provide the service, comply with applicable regulations and maintain traceability of blockchain operations when mandatory.
We apply technical and organisational measures (encryption, backups, access controls) to protect your data from unauthorised access, loss or alteration.
Please note that transactions published on blockchain networks may be immutable and publicly consultable; therefore we only publish the essential information on-chain.

contact.title: Contact
paragraphs: If you have questions about this policy or wish to exercise your rights, write to us at privacy@comunidad.viva.

terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.intro: These terms regulate the use of Truk. By creating an account and participating in the platform you agree to comply with the following conditions.

sections.title: 1. Acceptance of terms
paragraphs: Use of the platform implies complete acceptance of these terms and their updates. If you do not agree, you may stop using the service at any time.

sections.title: 2. Account and security
paragraphs: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your credentials and your account information.
You must notify us immediately if you detect unauthorised use or any security incident.

sections.title: 3. Offers and participation
paragraphs: The offers, events or services you publish must comply with current regulations and community rules.
You are responsible for the content you share, the operations you sign with your wallet and for complying with the agreements you reach with other users, on and off the chain.

sections.title: 4. Community credits
paragraphs: Truk credits are not fiat money or financial instruments.
Their function is to encourage exchange within the community and they cannot be redeemed for money outside the platform.
When credits or rewards are reflected in smart contracts or blockchain networks, you agree that their custody depends on the security of your wallet.

sections.title: 5. Community-generated content
paragraphs: You grant us a limited licence to host and display the content you share in order to operate the platform.
We may remove content we consider contrary to legislation or community rules.

sections.title: 6. Limitation of liability
paragraphs: Truk is offered "as is" and we do not guarantee that the service will be uninterrupted or error-free.
We are not responsible for agreements or transactions between users, nor for the custody of your wallets or private keys.
Blockchain operations are final; always review information before signing and only use secure devices.

sections.title: 7. Changes to terms
paragraphs: We may update these terms when we incorporate new functionalities or regulations require it.
We will notify you of relevant changes and, if you continue using the platform, you will be deemed to accept the new terms.

sections.title: 8. Applicable law and contact
paragraphs: These terms are interpreted in accordance with Spanish law.
For any enquiries you can write to us at legal@comunidad.viva.

header.title: üìö Documentation
header.subtitle: Everything you need to know about Living Community: our mission, features, how to use the platform, and how to contribute.

whatIs.title: What is Living Community?
whatIs.intro: Living Community is a local collaborative economy social network that connects people in your community to share resources, services, knowledge, and experiences.
whatIs.description: Our platform facilitates exchanges without the need for traditional money, promoting relationships of trust, solidarity, and mutual support among neighbors.

strengthen.title: Strengthen the local community
strengthen.description: Create strong bonds between neighbors, fostering cooperation and mutual understanding.

circular.title: Promote the circular economy
circular.description: Reduce waste by giving objects a second life and sharing underutilized resources.

access.title: Facilitate equitable access
access.description: Make goods and services accessible without economic barriers through a community credit system.

sustainability.title: Drive sustainability
sustainability.description: Reduce the ecological footprint by favoring local consumption and exchange over purchase.

reciprocity.title: ü§ù Reciprocity
reciprocity.description: What you give to the community comes back to you in multiple ways

trust.title: ‚≠ê Trust
trust.description: Reputation system based on generosity and reliability

democracy.title: üó≥Ô∏è Democracy
democracy.description: Important decisions are made through community consensus

transparency.title: üåê Transparency
transparency.description: Open source and visible community management

offersAndServices.title: üõçÔ∏è Offers and Services
offersAndServices.description: Publish and discover offers for goods, services, object loans, or exchanges.

timeBank.title: Time Bank:
timeBank.description: Offer your time and skills (classes, repairs, care)

localMarket.title: Local Market:
localMarket.description: Sell or exchange objects using credits or euros

loans.title: Loans:
loans.description: Share tools, books, or any object temporarily

geolocation.title: Geolocation:
geolocation.description: Find offers near you on the interactive map

creditsSystem.title: üí∞ Community Credits System
creditsSystem.description: Credits are our local virtual currency that facilitates exchanges without money.

howItWorks.title: How do credits work?
howItWorks.initialBalance: ‚Ä¢ You start with an initial credit balance when you register
howItWorks.earnCredits: ‚Ä¢ You earn credits by offering services and helping the community
howItWorks.spendCredits: ‚Ä¢ You spend credits accessing services and goods from other members
howItWorks.noRealMoney: ‚Ä¢ They cannot be converted to real money - they only have value within the community

events.title: üìÖ Community Events
events.description: Organize and participate in activities that strengthen community bonds.

swipe.title: Offers Swipe
swipe.description: Discover offers intuitively by swiping cards

stories.title: 24h Stories
stories.description: Share fleeting moments with the community

matches.title: Match System
matches.description: Connect with people who share similar interests

groupBuying.title: üõí Group Buying
groupBuying.description: Join collective purchases to get better prices and reduce costs.
groupBuying.access: ‚Ä¢ Access sustainable products at better prices
groupBuying.support: ‚Ä¢ Support local producers with grouped orders

governance.title: üó≥Ô∏è Community Governance
governance.description: Participate in important community decisions through a democratic system.

proposals.title: üèõÔ∏è Proposals
proposals.description: Any member can create improvement proposals

voting.title: üë• Consensus Voting
voting.description: Voting system that seeks collective agreement

transparency.title: üìä Total Transparency
transparency.description: All votes and decisions are public

reputation.title: ‚≠ê Reputation System
reputation.description: Your generosity score reflects your contributions to the community.

hybrid.title: üîÑ Hybrid Economic Layers System
hybrid.subtitle: The first platform that allows the peaceful coexistence of 3 different economic paradigms.

whatIs.title: What is the Hybrid System?
whatIs.description: It's a revolutionary system that allows you to choose how you want to participate in the economy: traditional capitalism, transitional economy, or pure gift economy. You decide!

migration.title: üîÑ Free Migration Between Layers
migration.description: Change economic paradigm whenever you want. Your choice, your freedom.

bridge.title: üåâ Bridge Events
bridge.description: Temporarily experiment with another layer. For example: "Money-free week".

threshold.title: üéØ Migration Threshold
threshold.description: If 70% of the community is in GIFT_PURE, collective migration is proposed.

celebrations.title: üéâ Abundance Celebrations
celebrations.description: Record and celebrate when the community shares resources generously.

gamification.title: üéÆ Gamification and Viral Engagement
gamification.subtitle: Complete gamification system that makes participating in the collaborative economy fun and addictive.

onboarding.title: üìö Gamified Onboarding
onboarding.bonus: üéÅ Bonus for completing everything: +50 total credits

stories.title: üìñ 24h Stories
stories.feature1: ‚Ä¢ Share photos and text for 24 hours

challenges.feature4: ‚Ä¢ Types: help neighbors, create offers, events

achievements.title: üèÜ Achievements System (70+ Badges)
achievements.description: Complete achievement and medal system with automatic progression

features.title: Features:
features.gallery: ‚Ä¢ üé® Visual gallery with filters by category and rarity

creditDecay.title: ‚è≥ Credit Decay (Rust Money)
creditDecay.description: Programmed credit obsolescence to encourage circulation
creditDecay.decay: ‚Ä¢ üìâ 2% monthly decay - Credits gradually lose value
creditDecay.protection: ‚Ä¢ üí∏ Only affects balances >100 credits - Protection for new users

notifications.thirtyDays: ‚Üí 30 days before: Warning of upcoming expiration
notifications.expired: ‚Üí Upon expiration: Notification of lost credits

creditDecay.objective: ‚Ä¢ üéØ Objective: Stimulate economic flow and avoid accumulation
creditDecay.cronJob: ‚Ä¢ ‚öôÔ∏è Daily cron job - Automatic processing at 3 AM
creditDecay.transparency: ‚Ä¢ üìä Total transparency - History visible in profile

why.title: üí° Why Rust Money?
why.description: Inspired by Silvio Gesell's economic theory, rust money incentivizes the circulation of money rather than accumulation, promoting a more active and redistributive economy. It's a key mechanism in reciprocity economies.

websocket.title: üåê WebSocket (Real-Time):
websocket.creditsUpdate: ‚Ä¢ üí∞ Credits update ‚Üí Notification in top bar
websocket.happyHour: ‚Ä¢ üéÅ Happy Hour activated ‚Üí Banner across entire app

email.title: üìß Email Notifications (25+ Templates):

highlights.title: ‚ú® Featured Highlights:
highlights.templates: ‚Ä¢ üé® Professional HTML templates with responsive design
highlights.colors: ‚Ä¢ üé® Dynamic colors based on notification type
highlights.ctas: ‚Ä¢ üîó CTAs (Call-to-action) with direct links to the app

governance.title: üèõÔ∏è Decentralized Governance - Proof of Help
governance.subtitle: Consensus system inspired by Bitcoin, where "mining" means helping others.

whatIs.title: What is Proof of Help (PoH)?
whatIs.description: A revolutionary consensus system where "mining" doesn't consume energy, but generates social value. Every hour of help to your community is a "proof of work".

mining.title: ‚õèÔ∏è Mining = Helping
mining.description: Instead of burning electricity, you generate "proof of work" by helping others. Zero energy consumption, 100% social value.

trustChain.title: ‚õìÔ∏è Trust Chain
trustChain.description: Every help is recorded on an immutable local blockchain. Total transparency and auditability.

reputation.title: üèÜ Social Reputation
reputation.description: Your reputation is automatically calculated based on your contributions. More help = more privileges.

reputationSystem.title: Reputation System
reputationSystem.description: Earn reputation by helping your community. More reputation = more privileges.

proposals.title: Community Improvement Proposals (CIPs)
proposals.description: Community Improvement Proposals: Any member with 20+ reputation can propose community improvements.

step1.title: 1. Creation
step1.description: Create your proposal with title, description and plan

quadraticVoting.title: üìä Quadratic Voting
quadraticVoting.description: System that prevents a few from dominating decisions:

moderation.title: üõ°Ô∏è Decentralized Moderation
moderation.description: Moderation isn't done by an admin, but by the community through temporary mini-DAOs.

step1.title: Report Content
step1.description: A user reports inappropriate content (spam, offensive, etc.)

step2.title: Jury Selection
step2.description: System selects 5-7 people: 3 with high reputation + 2 random

step3.title: Jury Voting
step3.description: Each juror votes: KEEP (maintain), REMOVE (delete), WARN (warning)

step4.title: Consensus (66%)
step4.description: If 66% vote REMOVE ‚Üí Content deleted. Correct jurors earn +1 credit

noSinglePoint.title: No single point of failure
noSinglePoint.description: The platform keeps working even if the central server fails

resistant.title: Censorship resistant
resistant.description: The community decides what content is appropriate

incentives.title: Aligned incentives
incentives.description: Helping and validating generates tangible rewards

transparency.title: Total transparency
transparency.description: All decisions are public and auditable

step1.title: Create your account
step1.description: Sign up with your email. It's free and you'll receive initial welcome credits.

step2.title: Complete your profile
step2.description: Add a photo, write a brief bio and tell us about your interests.

step3.title: Explore the map
step3.description: Discover what offers and events are near you on the interactive map.

step4.title: Post your first offer
step4.description: Have something to share? Create your first good or service offer.

step5.title: Connect with your community
step5.description: Send messages, attend events and build trusting relationships.

createOffer.title: üìù How to create an offer
createOffer.step1: Click "Create Offer" in the menu or quick action button
createOffer.step2: Select type: Time Bank, Local Market or Loan
createOffer.step3: Fill in title, detailed description and category
createOffer.step4: Set price in credits or euros (or both)
createOffer.step6: Add your location so others can find you on the map
createOffer.step7: Publish and wait for interested parties to contact you

organizeEvent.title: üéâ How to organize an event
organizeEvent.step1: Go to "Events" section and click "Create Event"
organizeEvent.step2: Define title, description and event type
organizeEvent.step3: Set start date, end and location
organizeEvent.step5: Optionally, offer credits as a reward for attending
organizeEvent.step6: Publish and promote your event in the community

clear.title: ‚úì Be clear and honest
clear.description: Accurately describe what you're offering to avoid misunderstandings

respond.title: ‚úì Respond quickly
respond.description: Answer messages within 24h to maintain trust

fulfill.title: ‚úì Fulfill your commitments
fulfill.description: If you meet with someone, respect agreements. Your reputation reflects it

rate.title: ‚úì Rate other members
rate.description: Leave honest reviews after each exchange

participate.title: ‚úì Participate actively
participate.description: Attend events, comment on the feed and grow the community

safety.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Safety Guidelines
safety.noPersonalInfo: ‚Ä¢ Don't share sensitive personal information in public messages
safety.publicPlaces: ‚Ä¢ Always arrange exchanges in public places if you don't know the person
safety.report: ‚Ä¢ Report inappropriate or suspicious behavior immediately
safety.checkReputation: ‚Ä¢ Check a member's reputation before arranging important exchanges

architecture.title: ‚öôÔ∏è Technical Architecture
architecture.description: Living Community is built with modern, robust and scalable technologies.

encryption.title: Communication Encryption
encryption.description: All communications use HTTPS with SSL/TLS certificates

protection.title: Data Protection
protection.description: Passwords are stored with bcrypt hash and never in plain text

rateLimiting.title: Rate Limiting
rateLimiting.description: Protection against brute force and DDoS attacks

accessControl.title: Access Control
accessControl.description: Role and permission system to protect sensitive data

docker.title: üê≥ Docker Infrastructure
docker.description: The entire application is containerized to facilitate deployment and scalability.

ssr.title: üöÄ Server-Side Rendering (SSR)
ssr.description: Server-side rendering for better SEO and performance

api.title: üåê REST API and Documentation
api.description: The API is fully documented with Swagger/OpenAPI.
api.explore: Explore all endpoints, parameters and responses interactively

deployment.title: üöÄ Production Deployment
deployment.subtitle: Complete guide to deploy Living Community on your server with Docker

prerequisites.title: üìã Prerequisites
prerequisites.docker: Server with Docker and Docker Compose installed

automatic.title: ‚ö° Option 1: Automatic Deployment (Recommended)
automatic.description: Use our automated script that handles everything:
automatic.check: ‚úì Checks that Docker and .env files are ready
automatic.verify: ‚úì Verifies that all services are running

step1.title: Step 1: Configure Environment Variables
step1.important: Important: Change passwords, JWT_SECRET and URLs in .env files

step4.title: Step 4: Apply Migrations
step4.cmd: docker compose exec backend npx prisma migrate deploy

domain.title: üåê Configure Domain with NGINX + SSL
domain.description: To use a custom domain with HTTPS:

step1.title: 1. Install NGINX and Certbot
step1.cmd2: sudo apt-get install nginx certbot python3-certbot-nginx

update.title: üîÑ Update the Application
update.migrateComment: # Apply migrations if there are new ones
update.migrateCmd: docker compose exec backend npx prisma migrate deploy

create.title: Create Backup
create.cmd:
docker compose exec postgres \
  pg_dump -U comunidad \
  comunidad_viva > \
  backup_$(date +%Y%m%d).sql

restore.title: Restore Backup
restore.cmd:
cat backup_20250101.sql | \
  docker compose exec -T \
  postgres psql -U comunidad \
  -d comunidad_viva

portInUse.title: Port already in use
portInUse.cmd1: sudo lsof -i :4000  # See what's using the port
portInUse.cmd2: sudo kill -9 PID    # Kill process if necessary

frontendConnection.title: Frontend doesn't connect to backend
frontendConnection.description: Verify that NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL in .env.production points to the correct backend URL

migrations.title: Migration error
migrations.description: Make sure PostgreSQL is running and DATABASE_URL is correct

docs.title: üìÑ Complete Documentation
docs.description: For more details, consult the DEPLOYMENT.md file at the project root.
docs.platforms: Also includes deployment options for Vercel, Railway, Render and DigitalOcean App Platform.

contribute.title: ü§ù How to Contribute?
contribute.intro: Living Community is an open source project that grows thanks to the participation of people like you. All contributions are welcome!

development.title: üíª Development
development.description: Help improve the code, fix bugs or add new functionalities.

design.title: üé® Design
design.description: Improve user experience and visual design.

documentation.title: üìù Documentation
documentation.description: Write guides, tutorials and technical documentation.

testing.title: üß™ Testing
testing.description: Test the application and report bugs or issues.

step2.title: 2. Create a branch for your feature

step3.title: 3. Develop your functionality
step3.compile: ‚Ä¢ Make sure everything compiles without errors

step4.title: 4. Commit your changes
step4.commitCmd: git commit -m "feat: clear description of the change"
step4.typesComment: # Commit types: feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, test

step5.title: 5. Push and create Pull Request
step5.description: Then go to GitHub and create a Pull Request with a clear description of your changes.

smallCommits.title: Small and frequent commits
smallCommits.description: It's easier to review specific changes than large blocks of code

descriptive.title: Descriptive commit messages
descriptive.description: Use the format: type(scope): clear description

document.title: Document complex functions
document.description: Helps other developers understand your code

style.title: Respect code style
style.description: Use Prettier and ESLint to maintain consistency

bugs.title: üêõ Report Bugs
bugs.description: If you find a bug, please report it by creating an issue on GitHub with:

discussions.title: GitHub Discussions
discussions.description: Participate in discussions about new features and improvements

issues.title: GitHub Issues
issues.description: Report bugs, request features or ask technical questions

pullRequests.title: Pull Requests
pullRequests.description: Review others' code and learn from the community

contributors.title: üåü Contributors
contributors.thanks: Thanks to all the people who have contributed to making Living Community a better platform every day.
contributors.yourName: Your name can appear here. Make your first contribution today!

license.title: üìÑ License
license.description: Living Community is licensed under MIT License.
license.details: This means you can use, modify and distribute the code freely, as long as you maintain the copyright notice and license.

hero.title: Save money, share resources, strengthen your community
hero.subtitle: The collaborative economy platform that connects neighbors to exchange services, share resources, and build a stronger community.

features.title: Everything you need in one place
features.subtitle: Three pillars to transform your local economy

marketplace.title: Local Marketplace
marketplace.description: Buy, sell, and trade with your neighbors. No intermediaries, no fees.

timebank.title: Time Bank
timebank.description: Exchange skills and time. One hour of your time is worth one hour of someone else's.
timebank.benefit3: Help and receive help from your community

community.title: Support Network
community.description: Participate in events, mutual aid projects, and community decisions.

impact.title: Our collective impact
impact.subtitle: Together we are building a fairer and more sustainable economy

howItWorks.title: How does it work?
howItWorks.subtitle: Get started in less than 5 minutes

step1.title: Sign up for free
step1.description: Create your account in 2 minutes. You only need an email or your Web3 wallet.

step2.title: Explore your community
step2.description: Discover offers, services, and events near you on the interactive map.

step3.title: Connect and collaborate
step3.description: Trade, share, help, and participate in your local community.

step4.title: Earn and save
step4.description: Accumulate credits, level up, and save money while strengthening your neighborhood.

finalCta.title: Ready to transform your local economy?
finalCta.subtitle: Join hundreds of people who are already saving money and building community.
finalCta.subtitle2: It's free ¬∑ No credit card required

header.title: Community Celebrations
header.subtitle: Magical moments where abundance met need. Anonymous celebrations of generosity and solidarity in our community.

empty.title: No celebrations yet
empty.description: Celebrations will appear here when the community shares abundance and meets needs anonymously and generously.

celebrations.participants: Approximately {count, plural, one {{count} person participated} other {{count} people participated}}

time.hoursAgo: {hours, plural, one {{hours} hour ago} other {{hours} hours ago}}

info.title: Why are they anonymous?
info.description: Celebrations are anonymous to protect the dignity of those who receive and the humility of those who give. What matters is not who participated, but that the community came together to meet a need. This is how we celebrate solidarity without singling anyone out.

hybrid.eventDescPlaceholder: Describe the purpose and activities of the event

dashboard.title: Flow Economics Dashboard
dashboard.subtitle: Real-time metrics of your community's economic health

info.title: What is Flow Economics?
info.description: Flow Economics is an economic system designed to promote wealth circulation and reduce inequality. When credits flow from higher balances to lower ones, extra value is generated through multipliers.
info.bullet1: Flow multipliers: up to 1.5x on transactions from high to low balance
info.bullet2: Community pools: 2% of each transaction goes to the common good
info.bullet3: Gini Index: measures economic equality (goal: keep below 0.4)
info.bullet4: Generosity rewarded: giving increases your influence in the community

semilla.title: SEMILLA Wallet
semilla.subtitle: Your federated currency for inter-community transactions

whatIs.title: What is SEMILLA?
whatIs.content: SEMILLA is the federated currency that connects all Truk communities. It enables transparent and traceable transactions between different groups.

form.reasonPlaceholder: Describe why you need these funds...

content.walletExplanation: A wallet is like your digital wallet, but you have full control. It doesn't depend on any bank or company.
content.benefit1: Connect without password - Secure authentication with your wallet
content.benefit2: Own your tokens - You control your digital assets
content.benefit3: Direct transactions - No intermediaries or hidden fees

faqs.question1: Do I need to buy cryptocurrencies?
faqs.answer1: No, you can use the entire Truk platform without buying cryptocurrencies. The wallet only gives you optional extra features.
faqs.answer2: Yes, your wallet is controlled only by you. No one else can access your funds or make transactions without your approval.
faqs.walletsComingSoon: More wallets coming soon: WalletConnect, Coinbase, Trust Wallet
